The sun emerges, tentative but determined, and so do the people along the banks of the Rh√¥ne. In winter, one need not look at the sky to gauge whether the weather outside is favorable‚Äîjust observe the number of people walking along the riverbanks. During harsh winter days, these paths remain utterly deserted, while on sunny winter afternoons, they become surprisingly crowded. One might wonder where all these people emerge from, as if the warmth summons them from hidden corners of the city. I too left my apartment to capture what warmth the sun offered. But I didn't forget my headphones, loaded with familiar old melodies that had accompanied countless walks before. There were fewer people than I

title: The Girl Who Paid at the Counter | John Samuel
description: The Girl Who Paid at the Counter - A story by John Samuel
content: The Girl Who Paid at the Counter | John Samuel Skip to main content John Samuel Home Writings BOOKS The Girl Who Paid at the Counter A Quiet Farewell to the Bookstore By John Samuel By a passenger among many, observing what we often forget to see It was 7:50 AM. I feared I would be late for the appointment. But something made me pause. Just across the street, a banner fluttered in the morning breeze‚Äîfaded but defiant. It hung above the bookshop where I had spent so many quiet afternoons. The shop was closing. A few well-wishers had put up the banner in protest, hoping perhaps for a last-minute miracle. Another casualty of the internet economy, I thought. The news stirred something deep in me. That bookshop had been a silent companion over the years. I often bought gifts there‚Äîmostly for birthdays, though truthfully, the birthdays were just an excuse. I wanted to be surrounded by pages and ink, by covers and the gentle rustle of paper. And now, it would all disappear. Quietly. Without f

title: The Touch of Homo sapiens: John Samuel
description: A reflection by John Samuel
content: The Touch of Homo sapiens: John Samuel Skip to main content John Samuel Home Writings The Touch of Homo sapiens A reflection by John Samuel 01001000 01010011 When it comes to the topic of preservation of cultural and human heritage, the first things that come to our mind are physical artifacts namely buildings, paintings, sculptures, clothes, tools, etc. Undoubtedly, many efforts are being made both at the national and international levels to protect and preserve the traces of our valuable heritage. However, the touch of Homo sapiens is not confined to physical artifacts. It is time to focus our attention to protect and preserve other traces of human heritage beyond confining ourselves to two of our major senses: touch and sight. Some people are increasingly interested to know the food habits of our ancestors and even their music. During the past several decades, human beings have moved several aspects of their lives to computers. Ever-evolving information technology solutions have bec

title: Why do I Marvel at Trees? - John Samuel
description:
Why do I Marvel at Trees?
                A contemplation by John Samuel
content: Why do I Marvel at Trees? - John Samuel Skip to main content John Samuel Home Writings Trees Why do I Marvel at Trees? A contemplation by John Samuel Albert Einstein once said, while studying the laws governing the universe, God does not place dice with the universe. This is exactly how I feel when I gaze upon trees. I marvel at them every time I see them. Every time, I sense that they are narrating a new story‚Äîtheir tale of being close to us, yet with branches that extend far beyond our reach. As we gaze upwards, we admire the intricate interplay of branches and leaves, the small gaps through which they allow light to pass, dispelling the potential darkness that their foliage might have cast if left unattended. The trees graciously permit these rays of light for us, for those of us beneath their shade, including the smaller plants. So majestic and glorious, yet generous! Trees, branches, and leaves. What's the secret behind their beauty? There exists an abundance of tree species, some

title: The Long Wait: John Samuel
description: A poem by John Samuel
content: The Long Wait: John Samuel Skip to main content John Samuel Home Writings The Long Wait A poem by John Samuel I am ready to wait. I am ready to wait, Till you give me back My dignity and my voice. The wait is long, But I am patient. A lot of us look at you, With supressed voices. I do the same, Hoping that one day, You will change your mind And give us back Our dignity and our voice. ¬© 2024 John Samuel. Patience, dignity, and hope endure.

As someone deeply engaged with Wikimedia Commons, Wikidata, and Wikipedia, I always treat these gatherings as an opportunity to both learn and contribute ‚Äî and also to rediscover the cities that host us through a Wikimedia lens. title: On Writing: John Samuel
description: Reflections by John Samuel
content: On Writing: John Samuel Skip to main content John Samuel Home Writings On Writing Reflections by John Samuel I am neither a writer nor a poet and have done no formal studies in literature. I write here just like any other ordinary person expressing my feelings around my life. Hence most of my writings tend to be in first person. I need to say that from time to time, I had adventured into writing, had stopped for a while and then I had restarted. My first experiences with writing come from my school days. I had participated in several story, essay and poem writing competitions. I also had very good encouragement from my teachers. It was also during this time that I came across people who were very good with their words. It seemed to me that words just flow for them when they start writing. And even now, I consider myself nowhere around them. Needless to say, I didn't continue serious writing after a while, keeping aside regular academic assignments. I love reading. As a researcher, I ne

title: In Your Arms: John Samuel
description: A poem by John Samuel
content: In Your Arms: John Samuel Skip to main content John Samuel Home Writings In Your Arms A poem by John Samuel I may travel to any place on the earth To see its wonders. They may amuse me for a while And may call me back again and again. But in the end, I just want to be back in your arms And to hold you tight. I travelled close to the sea. I saw beautiful beaches With blue blankets spread till the horizon. I saw both green and dry fields, With small trees and long grasses. But in the end, I just want to be back in your arms And to hug you tight. I travelled to historical places. I saw magnificient buildings With highly adorned doors and windows. I saw both palaces and ruins, With walls recounting numerous stories. But in the end, I just want to be back in your arms And to feel you tight. I travelled to hamlets and cities. title: Declarative Programming for Linked Data

The goal of this course is to give students an introduction to declarative programming for linked
                    data. Last two decades have seen the growing adoption of internet-connected device
content: Declarative Programming for Linked Data Declarative Programming for Linked Data Home Teaching Declarative Programming for Linked Data Description The goal of this course is to give students an introduction to declarative programming for linked data. Last two decades have seen the growing adoption of internet-connected devices which has resulted in an enormous release of data on a continuous basis. Handling of such enormous data from these interconnected devices requires a paradigm shift in our approach to programming. The course begins with an overview of the commonly used procedural programming languages and their limitations. Understanding data from interconnected devices requires an understanding of graphs, which forms the basis of linked data. A detailed study on various algorithms, particularly focusing on graphs will be done. We will then take a look at building and deploying Web 2.0 and Web 3.0 projects based on programming languages like Ruby, and the different ways by which da

title: MLP Visualization - Batch vs Stochastic Learning
description: Understanding how errors are handled during training
content: MLP Visualization - Batch vs Stochastic Learning üß† MLP Learning: Batch vs Stochastic Gradient Descent Understanding how errors are handled during training üìö Select Learning Mode: üéØ Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD) Update after EACH sample ‚Ä¢ Faster, more frequent updates ‚Ä¢ Weights change after every training example ‚Ä¢ Noisy but can escape local minima ‚Ä¢ Current loss shown per sample üì¶ Batch Gradient Descent Update ONCE per epoch ‚Ä¢ Accumulate gradients from all samples ‚Ä¢ Weights update after seeing all data ‚Ä¢ Stable, consistent gradient direction ‚Ä¢ Average loss across all samples Ready to Start Select a learning mode and click "Train Network" üìä Error Tracking for Current Epoch Total Accumulated Loss: 0.0000 üéì Train Network (1 Epoch) ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Forward Pass Only üîÑ Reset Network üé≤ Randomize Weights Speed: 1.0x Learning Mode SGD Current Phase Ready Average Loss 0.0000 Epochs Completed 0 Weight Updates 0 Input Layer Hidden Layer Output Layer Forward Signal Backward Gradient üìö Understanding Error Ha

title: Deep Learning (2019-2020): Project: John Samuel
description: Download the data from https://zenodo.org/record/3271358.
content: Deep Learning (2019-2020): Project: John Samuel Practicals: Deep Learning John Samuel Home Deep Learning Teaching Goals Understanding the translation pattern Exercise 1.1 Download Download the data from https://zenodo.org/record/3271358 . View the data contents. As you can see in the output, there are four columns: timestamp, property, language and type. Taking an example line from this dataset, 2013-09-10T22:43:54Z,P856,en,label corresponds to the action that an English label of Property P856 was added for the first time at 2013-09-10T22:43:54Z. Following is a description of each column. timestamp: the time at which an action was made. For example, 2013-09-10T22:43:54Z property: Wikidata property identifier. It uses the P-number, For example, P856 language: the language in which a label/description/alias was first translated type: It could be one of the following values: label, description and alias Creation of dataframe import pandas as pd dataframe = pd.read_csv("multilingual_wikida

You can use pip or conda Using Pip pip $ sudo apt install python-pip jupyter $ python3 -m pip install jupyter scikit-learn $ python3 -m pip install scikit-learn OR $ sudo apt install python-sklearn numpy $ python3 -m pip install numpy OR $ sudo apt install python-numpy pandas $ python3 -m pip install pandas OR $ sudo apt install python-pandas matplotlib $ python3 -m pip install matplotlib OR $ sudo apt install python-matplotlib tensorflow $ python3 -m pip install tensorflow Conda/Microconda Download Miniconda (relevant to your architecture) on your virtual machine. Run the executable. If successful, it must create miniconda2 dirctory in your home folder on your machine. jupyter $ conda install jupyter scikit-learn $ conda install scikit-learn numpy $ conda install n

content: Data Mining (2017-2018): Examination 1: John Samuel Questions: Data Mining John Samuel Accueil Data Mining Enseignement Questions: First session Year : 2017-2018 Duration : 2 hours Total : 15 points Documents : allowed Type of allowed documents : All documents allowed Electronic devices : not allowed Question 1 Consider an enterprise that has multiple internal websites using HTML and CSS linked to each other. Your goal is to collect all the web pages on these websites to create a central data store. You have access to the websites (i.e., HTML and CSS) but you do not have access to the databases behind these websites. What is your approach to download all the web pages? I would also like to acknowledge the team for incorporating the rainbow colors to this year's DebConf logo. I am John Samuel, and today I would like to talk about Building a Multilingual Command Line . title: Human Artifacts - Project 3D: John Samuel
description: Built Forms and Constructed Spaces
content: Human Artifacts - Project 3D: John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project 3D Human Artifacts Human Artifacts Built Forms and Constructed Spaces 70u 100u Human artifacts embody our species' unique capacity to transform raw materials into functional and aesthetic structures. From simple shelters to complex architectural systems, these constructions reflect our understanding of structural principles, material properties, and spatial organization. Each artifact represents a convergence of purpose and design‚Äîshelter from elements, pathways for movement, or platforms for elevation‚Äîdemonstrating how human ingenuity translates abstract concepts into tangible three-dimensional reality. Back to Project 3D Low-Poly House Stylized architectural form built from simplified geometric primitives, illustrating structure, proportion, and low-polygon design principles in residential architecture. Explore Model Podium Elevated platform demonstrating hierarchical structure and presentation space, showcas

title: Conclusion - Project 3D: John Samuel
description: Reflections and Horizons
content: Conclusion - Project 3D: John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project 3D Conclusion Conclusion Reflections and Horizons John Samuel ‚úèÔ∏è Drawing üé® Color üîÆ 3D ‚àû Future The Continuing Journey Beyond Drawing and Color What began as Project Drawing ‚Äîan exploration of line, form, and contour‚Äîevolved naturally into Project Color , adding chromatic depth to flat representations. Yet even with the richness of colored illustrations, something essential remained unexpressed: the true spatial nature of the objects being depicted. Project 3D represents the logical progression from these foundational explorations. Understanding three-dimensional modeling means transcending the limitations of flat surfaces, moving beyond the projection of depth into actual volumetric representation. This journey from 2D to 3D is not merely technical advancement‚Äîit's a fundamental shift in how objects are conceived, constructed, and understood. Lessons of Materials, Textures, and Light Three-dimensional modeling intro

title: Fundamental Shapes - Project 3D: John Samuel
description: Building Blocks of Three-Dimensional Space
content: Fundamental Shapes - Project 3D: John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project 3D Fundamental Shapes Fundamental Shapes Building Blocks of Three-Dimensional Space The fundamental shapes form the essential vocabulary of three-dimensional geometry. Each primitive‚Äîfrom the perfect symmetry of the sphere to the angular precision of the cube‚Äîrepresents a unique exploration of spatial properties: volume, surface area, symmetry, and curvature. These elemental forms serve as the foundation for understanding more complex geometric structures and spatial relationships. Back to Project 3D Plane Fundamental geometric surface in two dimensions, illustrating flatness, continuity, and orientation. Explore Model Sphere Perfect geometric primitive demonstrating spherical symmetry in three-dimensional space. title: Introduction - Project 3D: John Samuel
description: The Journey from 2D to 3D Spatial Representation
content: Introduction - Project 3D: John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project 3D Introduction Introduction The Journey from 2D to 3D Spatial Representation John Samuel Project Drawing 2D Lines Project Color 2D + Chromatic Project 3D Full Spatial Contour & Form Visual Richness Spatial Reality The Genesis The journey began with Project Drawing , an exploration of visual representation through plain line drawings. These initial sketches captured the essence of objects and concepts through strokes and contours, establishing a foundation for understanding form and structure in two-dimensional space. This evolved into Project Color , where the addition of chromatic information transformed these drawings into more expressive representations. Color brought depth, emotion, and context to the flat drawings, yet something fundamental remained unexplored‚Äîthe true three-dimensional nature of the objects being represented. Moving Beyond Flatness Despite the richness of colored drawings, a critical dimens

title: Motivation - Project 3D: John Samuel
description: The Drive Behind Three-Dimensional Exploration
content: Motivation - Project 3D: John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project 3D Motivation Motivation The Drive Behind Three-Dimensional Exploration John Samuel 0 Starting from Zero Learning Journal Inkscape Blender Cross-tool Learning Model Reusability Multi-view Understanding The Learning Journey Starting from Zero Every journey into a new domain begins at the beginning. Project 3D represents a deliberate commitment to learning three-dimensional modeling from first principles, without relying on prior expertise or shortcuts. This approach embraces the beginner's mindset‚Äîcuriosity without assumption, exploration without expectation. Starting from zero means accepting initial struggles: understanding coordinate systems, grappling with spatial transformations, and developing intuition for how objects exist in volumetric space. Each model, no matter how simple, represents genuine progress from this foundational starting point. Learning as Progress Documentation Project 3D serves as both a lear

title: Nature - Project 3D: John Samuel
description: Organic Forms and Natural Structures
content: Nature - Project 3D: John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project 3D Nature Nature Organic Forms and Natural Structures Nature's forms demonstrate the elegance of organic geometry‚Äîfrom the fractal branching of trees to the smooth curves of sand dunes shaped by wind, and the perfect ovoid of an egg. These models capture the essence of natural structures, where growth patterns, environmental forces, and biological imperatives create shapes that balance efficiency, beauty, and structural integrity. Each form tells a story of adaptation and evolution in three-dimensional space. Back to Project 3D Low Poly Tree Stylized low-polygon natural form composed of simple geometric volumes, illustrating abstraction, structure, and visual economy in representing organic growth. title: Software - Project 3D: John Samuel
description: Technologies and Workflows
content: Software - Project 3D: John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project 3D Software Software Tools Technologies and Workflows John Samuel Blender 3D Ctrl Alt T Digital Workshop Primary Software üé® Blender Blender serves as the primary 3D modeling, animation, and rendering software for Project 3D. As a comprehensive open-source 3D creation suite, Blender provides the complete toolset necessary for creating, manipulating, and exporting three-dimensional models. Its robust feature set includes polygon modeling, texture painting, rigging, animation, and rendering capabilities‚Äîall essential for developing the diverse range of models in this collection. Blender's open-source nature makes it freely accessible while maintaining professional-grade capabilities. Its active community, extensive documentation, and regular updates ensure continued learning opportunities and access to cutting-edge 3D modeling techniques. I am deeply grateful to all who have contributed to the development and evolution of Project Drawing . Friends and Reviewers To all my friends who have provided valuable comments and constructive feedback throughout the course of this project‚Äîyour insights have been instrumental in shaping my artistic direction. Your honest observations, suggestions for improvement, and words of encouragement have helped me refine my approach and maintain momentum during challenging periods. Your willingness to engage with these works, to see beyond their simplicity, and to offer thoughtful critique has made this project richer and more meaningful

title: Conclusion - Project Drawing: John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Conclusion - Project Drawing: John Samuel John Samuel Research Project Drawing Conclusion Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape: A Continuous Journey of Discovery John Samuel Lessons Learned Throughout this project, I have gained invaluable insights into both the artistic and technical aspects of digital drawing. These lessons have fundamentally shaped my approach to creating art with SVG and Inkscape, revealing the intricate relationship between memory, observation, and digital creation. The Illusion of Complete Memory I initially thought I knew the objects and their details intimately before attempting to draw them. However, the act of drawing itself revealed how incomplete my mental images truly were. I found it necessary to cross-check with real photographs for minute details‚Äîdiscovering that memory often captures essence rather than precision. This realization taught me humility and the importance of careful observation. The Value of Manual Tracing While working on a s

title: Dedication for Project Drawing: John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Dedication for Project Drawing: John Samuel John Samuel Research Project Drawing Dedication Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape John Samuel Dedicated to my Art and Drawing Teachers With Gratitude Over the past decade, this project has been shaped by the encouragement and feedback of numerous people‚Äîfriends, acquaintances, colleagues, and kind strangers who took the time to engage with my work. What some might dismiss as "naive" or "simplistic" drawings, these individuals saw as something worth nurturing and celebrating. Their words of encouragement have been invaluable. When doubt crept in, when I questioned whether these simple lines and shapes held any meaning, it was their feedback that reminded me of the value in continuing this journey. They saw beyond technical perfection to recognize the authenticity , the storytelling , and the personal expression embedded in each drawing. title: Introduction to Project Drawing: John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Introduction to Project Drawing: John Samuel John Samuel Research Project Drawing Introduction to Project Drawing Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape John Samuel A Journey Through Vector Art and Memory Welcome to my retrospective journey, Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape . In this endeavor, I delve deep into the realm of vector drawings and explore the profound impact of reusing them to craft a narrative that emerges from my works. At its core, this project revolves around SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics), a format often associated with crisp and precise visual representations. However, in my quest to recapture life's memories, SVG becomes more than just a file format‚Äîit transforms into a vessel for storytelling and self-expression . Embracing Imperfection What sets this endeavor apart is my commitment to embracing imperfections , mistakes , and errors . title: Motivation - Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape: John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Motivation - Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape: John Samuel John Samuel Research Project Drawing Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape John Samuel Embark on a captivating journey of rediscovery as I explore the intersection of art and technology through the project Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape . This artistic endeavor, driven by a passion for visualization, precision, and storytelling, delves into the meticulous recreation of memories that span a lifetime. Unraveling the transformation from paper to Inkscape, the exploration of perspective drawing, and the fusion of nostalgia with digital artistry are at the core of this project. Through this endeavor, I not only create art but also revisit the rich tapestry of life experiences, weaving personal stories into every stroke and line. title: Software Used for Project Drawing: John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Software Used for Project Drawing: John Samuel John Samuel Research Project Drawing Software Tools Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape John Samuel Primary Software Inkscape is the primary software used for creating all artworks in the Project Drawing . Inkscape is a powerful, free, and open-source vector graphics editor that provides professional-grade tools for creating scalable vector graphics (SVG). Its flexibility, precision, and extensive feature set make it ideal for this project's artistic and technical requirements. Inkscape Features and Tools The following sections detail the Inkscape features, tools, and keyboard shortcuts that I use extensively throughout this project. These tools enable precise control over vector graphics and facilitate the creative process. title: Project Color: Conclusion - John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Project Color: Conclusion - John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project Color Conclusion Reflections on a Chromatic Journey John Samuel The Genesis of Chromatic Expression Project Color emerged from Project Drawing ‚Äîa natural evolution driven by a desire to add color to my monochrome explorations. What began as simple line work demanded chromatic expression, transforming black and white compositions into vibrant memories painted with personal palettes. This project became an exploration of dimensionality ‚Äîmoving from pure 2D representations toward perspective drawing techniques that create 3D perceptions through carefully applied chromatic depth and spatial color relationships. Most fundamentally, it became an exploration of light itself ‚Äîunderstanding how light transforms color, how shadows add depth, how gradients suggest volume, and how strategic color placement can evoke the interplay of illumination and surface that defines our visual experience of the world. title: Project Color: Dedication - John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Project Color: Dedication - John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project Color Dedication To Those Who See Color in Everything John Samuel Dedicated to those who taught me to see the world not just in shapes, but in vibrant hues and shades With Chromatic Gratitude Over the years since embarking on this colorful journey, Project Color has been enriched by the observations and encouragement of countless individuals‚Äîfriends, colleagues, fellow artists, and generous strangers who took the time to engage with my chromatic explorations. What some might view as "naive color choices" or "simplistic palettes," these individuals recognized as authentic expressions of personal vision and emotional truth. Their feedback has been transformative. When I questioned whether my color interpretations were "correct" or sufficiently sophisticated, it was their responses that reminded me: color is not about technical accuracy alone‚Äîit's about feeling , memory , and personal perception . title: Project Color: Introduction - John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Project Color: Introduction - John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project Color Introduction to Project Color A Journey Through Vector Art, Memory and Colors John Samuel Origins of the Journey Welcome to this retrospective journey through Project Color ( Rediscovering Life Memories with SVG and Inkscape ). This project emerged organically when I began creating realistic images without color as part of Project Drawing . Gradually, I found myself experimenting with gradients of black to remain in the monochrome world, yet something was missing. I felt a growing need for a separate project where I could revisit some of my finished drawings and create dedicated color versions, breathing new chromatic life into familiar forms. Thus Project Color was born‚Äîsharing the same foundation of exploring vector art with SVG and Inkscape, but this time embracing the full spectrum of color. "Color is not just decoration‚Äîit is memory, emotion, and the essence of how we experience the world around us."

title: Project Color: Motivation - John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Project Color: Motivation - John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project Color Motivation The Journey from Monochrome to Chromatic Expression John Samuel A Learning Journey from Zero Project Color emerged from a simple yet profound realization: while Project Drawing taught me the fundamentals of form and composition through monochrome vector art, there remained an entire dimension of visual expression waiting to be explored‚Äîthe world of color. Starting from zero knowledge of color theory, I embarked on a systematic learning journey. Each colored drawing became both a finished piece and a documented learning moment, tracked meticulously through version control. This approach transformed my creative process into a learning journal , where I could trace my progress, revisit decisions, and understand how my color perception evolved over time. üé® Color Wheel Mastery Understanding relationships between hues, complementary colors, and harmonious palettes üîç ColorZilla Exploration Learning to e

title: Project Color: Software Tools - John Samuel
description: John Samuel
content: Project Color: Software Tools - John Samuel John Samuel Home Research Project Color Software Tools The Digital Palette for Chromatic Creation John Samuel üé® üñåÔ∏è üé≠ Open Source Tools for Color Expression Project Color is built entirely using open source software , demonstrating that professional-quality chromatic art can be created without proprietary tools. The primary software ecosystem combines vector graphics creation with color analysis utilities to enable systematic exploration of color theory and application. My commitment to open source reflects a belief that creative tools should be accessible to everyone, regardless of economic resources. These tools have proven more than capable of supporting complex chromatic explorations and artistic vision. Primary Software Tools üé® Inkscape The cornerstone of Project Color, Inkscape is a professional vector graphics editor that provides comprehensive tools for creating scalable, high-quality colored artwork.
